visualization_prompt: Generate a bar chart showing honey composition percentages using stacked percentage formatting with pattern fills
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a unidimensional composition breakdown with five percentage components summing to 100%. Original data from Wikipedia demonstrates biochemical constituents of honey, validated through nutritional science literature. Synthetic augmentation wasn't required as source data provided complete proportional relationships. The stacked bar chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating axes decorations while maintaining proportional accuracy through Tufte's principle of graphical integrity. Pattern fills address Cairo's preattentive processing principles for categorical distinction without color reliance. Percentage formatting (μ=20, σ=14.3 across components) enables direct magnitude comparisons while stacked organization reveals part-to-whole relationships through Weber-Fechner compliant visual weighting.
